w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic collective nouns by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
bouquet of flowers, class of students, flock of birds, herd of cows, deck of cards, loaf of bread, crowd of people, te
am of players, pack of wolves, cutting the loaf of bread, teaching the class of students, giving the bouquet of flowers
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for collective nouns
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: bouquet, class, flock, herd, deck, loaf, crowd, team, pack
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about collective nouns!”
A noun is a person, place, thing or animal
Draw a person, place, thing or animal
Circle the poster and read it like this:
A noun is a person, place, thing or animal.
Clear the screen and ask the child to draw a person. Repeat with a place, thing and animal.
Circle the different groups of people and say,
and have the child repeat. Then read the definition to the student. Underline the word,

A crowd of people, a team
of players, a class of students.

Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
bouquet, class, flock, herd, deck, loaf, crowd, team, pack
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
